senses.sense_definition: To package a software application together with its dependencies so it can run consistently on any computing environment.

examples.text: Developers often <w>containerize</w> applications to ensure they work the same way on every server.
We decided to <w>containerize</w> the database to simplify the deployment process.

senses.sense_definition: To pack cargo into large, standardized metal boxes for transport by ship, truck, or train.

examples.text: It is much more efficient to <w>containerize</w> goods than to load them individually.
The exporter plans to <w>containerize</w> the machinery to protect it during the voyage.

senses.sense_definition: To modify a port, ship, or industry to handle standardized shipping containers.

examples.text: The city had to <w>containerize</w> the old harbor to compete with modern international ports.
Efforts to <w>containerize</w> the fleet required significant financial investment.
